item.title: FATAL EXCEPTION! (HALO VOICE) Heres a picture
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:6, topic:361925”][quote author=Scape-JAVA link=topic=458203.msg3352939#msg3352939 date=1285520448]
Theres your problem, arrayIndexOutOfBoundsExceptions commonly occurs when somebody edits a cfg file, so go look through the CFG file you recently edited, don’t use space bar in cfg files, use the tabs key.
[/quote]
Using spaces instead of tabs would throw NumberFormatException
He did something wrong when adding the drops I suppose.[/quote]

Whoops, meant to say something like this:

java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException was thrown to indicate that an array was accessed with an out of bounds index.

Read full topic

item.title: FATAL EXCEPTION! (HALO VOICE) Heres a picture
item.dc:creator: @KushScape KushScape
item.description:
@KushScape wrote:

Welcome to the world of java, where you press 1 button to fuck your whole life over.

yeah im going to remove cfg files and then re add the ones that i didnt change

item.title: FATAL EXCEPTION! (HALO VOICE) Heres a picture
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Scape-JAVA:

Theres your problem, arrayIndexOutOfBoundsExceptions commonly occurs when somebody edits a cfg file, so go look through the CFG file you recently edited, don’t use space bar in cfg files, use the tabs key.

Using spaces instead of tabs would throw NumberFormatException
He did something wrong when adding the drops I suppose.

Read full topic

yeah i needed to add drop rates

Theres your problem, arrayIndexOutOfBoundsExceptions commonly occurs when somebody edits a cfg file, so go look through the CFG file you recently edited, don’t use space bar in cfg files, use the tabs key.
